DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: No, No, I’ve got it… I think. Has anyone used one of these before?

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: Login accepted. Welcome to Colony Planner version 3.0. Hello again Captain, how was your journey?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: And hello again to you too. A thousand years of cryosleep isn’t anything like eight hours in bed.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: Was it not refreshing, Captain?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: Have you ever woken up half a galaxy away from where you went to sleep? Actually, I suppose you have, you know what? Let’s get started. Welcome to… our new home.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: This is Kepler 442-b, one of Earth’s newest outposts. It doesn’t look like a colony yet, that’s why we have you.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: The Human Colonisation Project guarantees every colonist their own plot of land, but not all spaces are created equal. We need you to plan our colony and make it a home, according to what each colonist wants and needs from their new life.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: We didn’t have much time for icebreakers, I’m afraid, you’ll have to start from scratch. Get talking to our passengers to find out what makes them happy, make sure they like their neighbors too!

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: Hello, Professor. I’m here to help you find your new home.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Professor
DialogueBody.Line: I’ve been reading about you, what a fascinating little program you are. How do you do?

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: I am not sure I understand the question, Professor.

Options.OptionText: Why did you leave Earth?
What do you think of Kepler?
What does home mean to you?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Professor
DialogueBody.Line: This is confidential, isn’t it?

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: My lips are figuratively sealed.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Professor
DialogueBody.Line: The academic community on Earth is far too traditional to appreciate my research. I want to be an innovator, a trailblazer, I can only hope there are other scientific minds like mine on this ship.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Professor
DialogueBody.Line: Humans discovered Kepler 442-b in the dark ages of the 21st century, long before we could dream of reaching it. Were you aware that ancient telescopes could not tell whether a planet had a breathable atmosphere?

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: Yes, my purpose is to know-

DialogueBody.Speaker: Professor
DialogueBody.Line: Those poor, poor people, living their lives as if Earth was all they needed.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Professor
DialogueBody.Line: Home is my research! Unlike that so-called ‘survival’ expert, some of us are here for peace. Wherever I can focus, wherever my work takes me, that’s home.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: Hello-

DialogueBody.Speaker: Astronomer
DialogueBody.Line: Oh!

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: Did I startle you?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Astronomer
DialogueBody.Line: No! Well… yes.

Options.OptionText: Why did you leave Earth?
What do you think of Kepler?
What does home mean to you?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Astronomer
DialogueBody.Line: On Earth, I haven’t seen the stars in years… nothing gets through the smog. Here, I have a head start on them

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: A head start on who?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Astronomer
DialogueBody.Line: The people, the sightseers! Earth was nothing but a travel destination.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Astronomer
DialogueBody.Line: I can’t stop looking at it. Have you seen the mountains? Imagine what the night sky could show you up there...

DialogueBody.Speaker: Astronomer
DialogueBody.Line: Home is… what I see when I look up.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Ranger
DialogueBody.Line: You busy?

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: I can perform millions of functions simultaneously.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Ranger
DialogueBody.Line: Functions like getting me a good spot?

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: I can certainly try.

Options.OptionText: Why did you leave Earth?
What do you think of Kepler?
What does home mean to you?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Ranger
DialogueBody.Line: Doesn’t really matter, they followed me here anyway.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: They?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Ranger
DialogueBody.Line: Yeah, him.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Ranger
DialogueBody.Line: I want to take a picture of it to send back to Earth. That forest? Those mountains? We used to have sights like that around my hometown.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: While you were growing up?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Ranger
DialogueBody.Line: No. Long, long before me.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Ranger
DialogueBody.Line: So that’s what you want all of us to think about this place - that it’s home.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: That is what I’m optimized to do.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Ranger
DialogueBody.Line: Just give me somewhere to wander, I’ll figure out the rest.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: I see that you requested a custom greeting. My apologies, I will start again.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: Ahoy.

Options.OptionText: Why did you leave Earth?
What do you think of Kepler?
What does home mean to you?
Options.Hint: Wants to keep his children safe.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Angler
DialogueBody.Line: Family decision. Sure Earth has the best schools, megacities, birthplace of humanity and all that, but no space for people.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Angler
DialogueBody.Line: You reckon there’s fish in that river? Like, alien fish?

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: I have no data on this planet’s native fauna.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Angler
DialogueBody.Line: Sounds like you’re gonna need a guy who brought his own rod.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Angler
DialogueBody.Line: To me? Home’s just where my kids grow up, ask them. But between you and me, home isn’t anywhere near one of those eccentric-types, make sure of that for me.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: Hello, Captain.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: Ah, Planner, do you need any help?.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: Actually, it is your turn to to discuss your new home.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: Of all the things to forget… alright, ask away.

Options.OptionText: Why did you leave Earth?
What do you think of Kepler?
Options.Hint: Wants to live near the Executive.

Options.OptionText: What does home mean to you?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: Well… I’m the Captain.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: And why not return, if you had the opportunity?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: My job is a lot like yours - I’ve watched over these people through a thousand years in space, and I need to watch over them here too. I don’t care about the mountains, or the beach, put me somewhere where I can still lead.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: Beautiful but… expensive.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: Expensive?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: If anyone on this ship still has any life savings, I’d be surprised. Well, excluding our top donor. I should probably try to keep him happy…

DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: My passengers are after something they couldn’t get on Earth - have you ever stopped to think about how strange it is, settling on another planet to build a version of Earth you never experienced yourself?

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: Captain, what does home mean to you?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: To me?

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: Yes, to you. What does home mean to you?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Captain
DialogueBody.Line: Home is… home is where I’m needed.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: Hello, Colonist.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: … Hello, Colonist?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Prepper
DialogueBody.Line: What do you want?

Options.OptionText: Why did you leave Earth?
What do you think of Kepler?
What does home mean to you?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Prepper
DialogueBody.Line: Earth’s doomed. As good as dead. I bet it’s gone already. All because those corporations just had to squeeze it for the cash.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: And you wish to rebuild?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Prepper
DialogueBody.Line: Nah, I’m gonna make this planet a bigwig-free zone.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Prepper
DialogueBody.Line: Nice place. I’m keeping it that way.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Prepper
DialogueBody.Line: Why’s that any of your business?

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: I have no business.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Prepper
DialogueBody.Line: Just put me somewhere I don’t have leave someday, got it? I had a nice thing going back on Earth, a hideout in the woods, but I never knew if it was gonna be there tomorrow.

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: Hello, Colonist, I see you are busy.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Athlete
DialogueBody.Line: Two more laps! I’m setting this planet’s world records - who says a marathon needs more than one runner anyway?

Options.OptionText: Why did you leave Earth?
Options.Hint: Wants to run on the beach.

Options.OptionText: What do you think of Kepler?
What does home mean to you?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Athlete
DialogueBody.Line: I’m tired of treadmills. I ran on a beach once, and now I’m here I’m not going to run on anything else.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Athlete
DialogueBody.Line: I think I’m going to like it…

DialogueBody.Speaker: AI
DialogueBody.Line: You sound unsure.

DialogueBody.Speaker: Athlete
DialogueBody.Line: The first thing that Professor said to me is that I better not be planning to use my speaker setup. How am I supposed to run without music?

DialogueBody.Speaker: Athlete
DialogueBody.Line: No fences or walls. I’m not moving from one box to another.
